text: Just a reminder that we’d love to have our friends and supporters join us for our watch party tonight! Campaign HQ (2880 Zelda Rd) @ 7:30.

Andrew Young knows what it takes to lead & transform a city. He's convinced Artur Davis is Montgomery's best option.
https://t.co/2oS5wMP4Ae
Just cast our votes to create a brighter future for all of Montgomery. Make sure you do the same today! #electionday http://t.co/RH5lRXc4aR
Made a couple of pit stops during lunch. We were thrilled to see all of the support. Can't wait for tomorrow's vote! http://t.co/2phw0UHQ8c
Tara and I visited Beulah Baptist and Macedonia Miracle Kingdom today for two uplifting, empowering messages. http://t.co/HUkOarMnIJ
As we leave her funeral mass, our thoughts and prayers are with Beverly Ross' friends and family. She will be greatly missed.
Great afternoon listening to the concerns of folks at Narrow Lane Barber Shop. Lots of support and encouragement! http://t.co/xLyWtj9wl1
Just a reminder that the @wsfa12news mayoral forum hosted by @markb_wsfa & @VC_Law kicks off live @ 7:00 on TV & online. Be sure to tune in!
Great day listening to the concerns of seniors at CaraVita, South Haven, Country Cottage, Woodley Manor & Elmcroft! http://t.co/PQsIiq2j9m
Visiting four nursing homes today as we reach out to MGM’s seniors to help make our city great. Our motto now is no voter left untouched!
Talking jobs, development, and the plan to make Montgomery great for all of us with @JennWSFA. Six days to go! http://t.co/hEdv3DQ2vx
AD: MPD needs more transparency. Period. Public complaints & their review results need to see the bright light of day, not be hidden away.
AD: Curfews may seem like a good idea, but it's hard to apply them equally. Instead of City Hall, let's ask parents to take care of kids.
AD: Strange increased the budget by $13 million over 6 years. Do you see $13 million worth of progress, or just more fees and less growth?
AD: Fighting crime means getting tough on criminals, but it also means tackling the causes of crime. Kids need better choices & educations.
AD: 3 requirements to grow MGM's economy. Demand reciprocal investment, create more buying power by upping min wage, & fight payday lenders.
Kicking off tonight's NMNA debate. AD: MGM is my home. It made me who I am. I want to make it great for kids like me. http://t.co/tK4XFaJoAX
@RealRayrita I’m sure we can figure out a way to get someone to you. Give our office a call tomorrow morning (334.517.1192) to schedule!
@RealRayrita Hey there! Sorry to hear about the residue on your windshield. We'd be happy to have someone clean it for you. Let us know!

The MGM Mayor's race is tightening: Todd Strange and Artur Davis appear to be headed for a runoff.
http://t.co/k9zz9jw8Az
Spent Sunday at Freewill MBC with Pastor Nettles after our team hit over 1,000 homes yesterday! http://t.co/nirRL2evbg
Thanks to Fortis College for honoring me with the chance to address their grads. Best of luck to the class of '15! http://t.co/ULaEde04No
AD: Montgomery doesn't belong to Strange and his crowd. They don't have a special claim on City Hall. Change starts now. #MGMmayordebate
Strange on crime: "I don't want to talk about statistics." #mgmmayoraldebate
AD: How to get MGM into financial shape? Spend smarter & trim fat. Start by cutting the $670k/yr Office of Public Safety. #mgmmayoraldebate
@BaronColeman Nah. Just his comms guy.
AD: We need to reopen MGM's closed community centers as job training hubs rather than pass the buck on who closed them. #mgmmayoraldebate
AD: What's MGM's biggest challenge? Losing our future. We must keep our best & brightest here after college w/ STEM jobs. #mgmmayoraldebate
Just a reminder for those of you unable to attend that @MGMAdvertiser will be live streaming tonight's mayoral forum on their website!
So MGM got an award for a "partnership" that increased garbage fees last year? Finishing what Todd started, indeed... http://t.co/WrjpneXLoS
Check out our new TV spot: Todd Strange's Montgomery is making a name for itself for all the wrong reasons… https://t.co/vDoWwalJHg
Big thanks to @yawn_meister and @MGMAdvertiser for a great piece on the specifics of our crime, edu, and dev plans... http://t.co/Q87W2suVCc
Spent Sunday at Holt Street MBC and enjoyed Rev. McClung's sermon on God's redemptive power. http://t.co/J0nhlpzPp7
Despite the heat, our canvassers knocked 800 doors today in Sheridan Heights, Morningview, Bellehurst, Southlawn! http://t.co/CzzJyx2AgS
Thanks to @MGMAdvertiser's @yawn_meister for a great interview this afternoon. Look for the story next week! http://t.co/dnlC5Zq3Ss
Held a great joint press conference with Ella Bell to address impacts of cuts to Medicaid, Edu. Trust Fund on MGM. http://t.co/s2HXBBrPLy
Attended four National Night Out events. Over and over, I heard the concern that MGM isn't as safe as it needs to be. http://t.co/giYUPgEhrX
Big thanks to the fine folks of Gibbs Village for having us out to kick off their inaugural National Night Out with a chat about community.
AD: What will I do on the off chance I lose? Hit the ground running with the Davis for Mayor 2019 campaign. I'm invested in MGM. Period.
AD: Leaders should do more just pay lip service to youth. They should make youth a part of the process from City Hall all the way down.
AD: What does Forbes think of Montgomery's job growth? We're ranked 190th out of 200 in USA. We need job centers & training, not rhetoric.
AD: the face of crime keeps changing, making its way downtown and east. We need more cops and should axe Pub. Safety Dir. to help fund them.
Tonight's @EmergeMtgy mayoral forum is kicking off in a full house! Watch here: http://t.co/2WtSuh780l #emerge2mayor http://t.co/GJKtOrjIIz
AD: women should never be arrested on preexisting warrants before receiving DV intervention help when seeking it at One Place. End of story.
AD: rehabilitating offenders means successful reintegration into society. MGM must make work easier & end "check the box" for some city jobs
AD: reducing DV rates in MGM requires real world & online battles that necessitate creative leadership & aggressive, imaginative solutions.
AD: we must direct City Attorney & muni courts to aggressively pursue abusers regardless of any other ongoing cases in other jurisdictions.
AD: Elder abuse is both physical and financial. We have to fight it on both fronts using both  MPD & city council's enforcement authority.
AD: One Place needs a bigger space, and it should be chosen based on program need & expert input rather than as part of a development plan.
AD: MGM has to tighten up crime data collection & reporting to give community and govt better info to create policy to fight DV & all crime.
The DVTF Forum is underway: Davis' focus is on more PD training, upping One Place funding to fight domestic violence. http://t.co/OJHfLDXqsp
AD: in closing, party doesn't matter. Ideas & solutions do. MGM can & should be better for all; change candidates are united in that belief.
AD: attracting new big biz to MGM requires better education system, improved health care, and dev in parts of city that serve as gateways.
AD: Strange hasn't worked hand in hand w/ city council; next mayor should collaborate & communicate to build consensus, not work in secret.
AD on tourism: city should've done more w/ Selma - MGM 50th; should shout civil rights legacy, build MLK statue, become focus of that story.
AD: MGM dev is unequal, unjust. We need to use city zoning auth to fight that, create citizen zoning oversight council to direct dev to need
AD's first 100 days priorities: raise min wage for big box retailers, appt econ dev task force, reorganize cabinet for efficiency and impact
AD: What to do about unequal investment in MGM? Make firms getting city $ to dev downtown reinvest some profits in our distressed zips.
Kicking off tonight's MIA/MCDP/MCDC forum. All five candidates are in attendance and an engaged room is ready to hear their vision for MGM.
Just saw where the mayor's campaign is writing checks to black churches. Guess what: that doesn't work anymore.
In closing: what do we want MGM to be? We must fight poverty, city debt, crime, and pop. loss if we're ever going to be a truly great city.
Davis on biggest accomplishments: putting criminals away as an AUSA in MGM, saving Hope 6 and the black farmer's suit as a congressman.
Davis on revenue: no need for occupational or property taxes, need to eliminate waste starting with $670k/yr public safety director's office
Development, pt. 2: Bright's downtown dev plan got us where we are today, used private $. Mayor needs to focus city $ on distressed areas.
Davis on city schools: worry less about the politics of why we can't. Have to put kids first and find ways to make it happen as a community.
Davis on education: when are we going to address the 27k kids left out of the MPS top tier? Make the mayor accountable for a city system!
Davis on blight: why not use demo money to fund rehabs and rebuilds by citizens instead & use zoning/regulatory power to fight slumlords?
Davis on development: we need to be more aggressive in using city funds to bring growth where it's needed most, renew focus on transparency.
We're underway at the LWV/NPC forum. The three things that set Artur's candidacy apart? Determination, vision, drive. http://t.co/aAISuWwaxh
Montgomery made national news in the worst way today; another reason we need a Public Health Commission. http://t.co/a3XJ7qipW0
You saw my anti-crime plan. Here’s a copy of Strange’s. Yes, those are Grinches. http://t.co/U13M0CnI8x
We spent Sunday at Maggie St. Baptist: Rev. Pettway let me talk about being a Mayor for the whole city of Montgomery. http://t.co/HkyIcs9LGp
Phi Beta Sigma's forum was a great chance to talk ideas for the 4/5 of the field that actually showed up. #WheresTodd http://t.co/tAVKAyltfy
Stopped by Mt. Gilliard Baptist's wellness fair. It was good to be back home in the church my grandfather founded. http://t.co/TVXSZaz7Qx
Strange says I haven't lived in MGM in 30 years. Fact: when he was selling used cars, I was an AUSA in MGM putting ppl away for drug crimes.
Talking crime, jobs, development, and population loss in MGM with @JennWSFA. Tune into @wsfa12news at 6:00 for more! http://t.co/iIyAdJSriv
The Mayor’s new job announcement? Wait for it… another call center with jobs at $8.75/hr. Are low wage jobs what we’re known for now?
Spent lunchtime addressing the MGM Association of Legal Professionals: a lot of talk about crime and what the right Mayor could do to fix it
Our new TV ad, "Crime", goes up today. It captures what people are saying all over #Montgomery. https://t.co/X8R2h0iUCU
Turning from crime to talk jobs, city budgets, debt, and education w/ a room full of concerned, frustrated MGM voters http://t.co/WXaOmG5exX
MGM needs a new police officer retention program; Finley (not Murphy) should be empowered to run PD above politics. http://t.co/jECBPiblR3
Fight crime's causes: intervene w/ at risk teens & ex-offenders, add cabinet dept to promote neighborhood, faith-based, and nonprofit orgs.
Focused deterrence: MGM needs more cops, zero gang tolerance, neighborhood security cams, and common sense ordinances http://t.co/gVDWDc4UOc
Talking focused deterrence and the root causes of crime as Artur delivers details of his plan to fight crime in MGM. http://t.co/svGeXiPoeL
Just a reminder that we're hosting a town hall to roll out our detailed crime plan tonight! 6:30 @ Faulkner Biz School (5345 Atlanta Hwy).
Announcing our detailed plan to attack crime in MGM focusing on tougher enforcement & attacking root causes of crime: http://t.co/eJlHdQuatM
So incredibly proud of Tara and her Women's Day speech at Shiloh Missionary Baptist. A standing ovation! http://t.co/o7ZR4EMI9P
No, Mayor: MGM is not safer. Safe cities don't erupt in gunfire during a baseball game.
That's us out knocking doors in 102 degree heat, folks. Team Davis is sweating it out for a better #Montgomery ! http://t.co/E4b6tCqTNn
Our next town hall: Faulkner Biz School, 7/20 at 6:30PM. Announcing this election's first detailed anti-crime plan to make Montgomery safer.
Davis: "We're engaged in a competition with gangs in this city and the prize is our young men."
Davis pledges to shut down debtor's prison program that's led to multiple lawsuits against the city, says the poor deserve real justice.
Davis now extending economic vision with details about his plan to make biz getting city incentives reinvest returns in distressed areas.
Davis opening tonight's debate with specific details about his vision for a development corridor to drive growth in forgotten southwest MGM.
Tara and I spent Sunday at Mt Zion AME Zion Church: a powerful msg from Rev. Shuford on the power of the right cause. http://t.co/JPgCj3Rii8

Finishing up: just told the standing room crowd that I'll work to bring the American Dream back to MGM and I intend to keep that promise.
An hour into this forum and Artur's the only one willing to pull back the curtain on the issues City Hall would rather keep in the closet.
Just kicking off tonight's mayoral forum and Strange is already using his opening statement to make excuses for poor economic performance.
So now we're official: just qualified to run for Mayor. 48 days to go! http://t.co/v860I7Z6h1
